alert.note: Alert for Brown; Callahan; Coleman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 22 at 1:12AM CDT until June 22 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Callahan County in west central Texas... Brown County in west central Texas... Coleman County in west central Texas... * Until 215 AM CDT. * At 112 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Echo, or 7 miles east of Silver Valley, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Coleman, Burkett and Cross Cut around 120 AM CDT. Valera around 125 AM CDT. Santa Anna, Grosvenor and Byrds around 135 AM CDT. Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Lake Brownwood and Lake Brownwood State Park around 140 AM CDT. Bangs and Gouldbusk around 150 AM CDT. Early and Trickham around 155 AM CDT. Brownwood, Camp Bowie and Rockwood around 200 AM CDT. Brookesmith around 205 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Echo, Mozelle, Goldsboro, Whon, Fisk, Thrifty, Indian Creek, Us- 283 Near The Coleman-Callahan County Line, Lake Coleman and Shields. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
